page.title: 17Religion In South Kyme
page.content: There are two places of worship, a Church of England church and a Wesleyan Chapel. Children of both attend a Sunday School, held in the Chapel every Sunday. There are people of other faiths in the village; Roman Catholics, Jehovah's Witnesses and Spiritualists. They travel 9 miles to Sleaford to worship. Church attendance has declined greatly in the past years. The vicarage was sold and the vicar now lives 6 miles away, having 7 parishes to attend to. It is difficult for him to fit in services. We have two each month at St. Mary's Church, but the chapel is used every Sunday. Harvest Festivals are held yearly. Children have an anniversary and sometimes a Christmas play. Midnight Mass on Christmas Eve is held every 4th year. Charges: wedding-Â£44, funeral_Â£36.
